issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Steps:
1) Log in as admin@eucalyptus
2) From drop down menu at "admin@eucalyptus" on upper right select "Manage credentials"
3) Change password to "test"
No validation error is displayed.
Internal error is displayed after the password change is submitted

attachment.filename: Matched passwords error for no match.png

fields.summary: Change of password for admin@eucalyptus results in internal server error when new password is less than 6 characters long

comments.body:
It worked fine for me on our team dev cloud
Did you enter the wrong current password? I wonder what could be different in your current setup?
[~dkavanagh] I tested on both shared 4.1.1 test clouds. You can reproduce it on  https://10.111.5.132/ admin@eucalyptus It works for non-eucalyptus account.
[~dkavanagh] Tested again to make sure there was no pwd mismatch on admin@eucalyptus. Yes, it gives internal error.
I just tried this and it worked, logged in with foobar and changed password to "eucalyptus" cc:[~alice]

this seems to work unless the user enters the wrong curent PW. We should be flagging that on submit and displaying it as an error so they can go back and correct it, not just surfacing an internal server error.

Also, the button should be disabled until all fields contain data, and until both new PW fields match, will need to adjust validation there. Note that the validation error message styling does not seem to have the correct class applied as well, that needs to be fixed too.
There is no validation when a short 4 character new password is supplied, and console throws internal error. I think that was the problem all along, because I was always using short new pwd.
[~ashamblin], do you need more than what I specified a couple of comments above this? LMK, and if there's a list of possible error conditions we don't have covered here we can go through them all.

[~lnajjar], [~jloza]  Attached a screenshot.  This is an older form with no client-side validation beyond matching new passwords and strength score (weak, medium, strong).

The current design would put validation error messages where the strength message goes now.   How should we reconcile this.
The passwords must match message is not current.  Should it open in a new notification message at the top?

Some thoughts, subject to improvement by [~jloza].

1. If the "New password" is not valid, display the validation error below the field. Do not display the weak strength message. Display the "Change Password" button as unavailable.
2. If the "New password" is valid but weak, display the weak strength message.
3. If the "Confirm new password" entry does not match the "New password" entry, display the "passwords do not match" error below the "Confirm new password" field. Display the "Change Password" button as unavailable.
4. If the "New password" is valid and the "Confirm new password" entry matches, display the "Change Password" button as available. After the user selects the "Change Password" button, display a notification that you successfully changed your password.
[~jloza] Yes, I agree. Please push this ticket to 4.3
Done. heads-up for [~ashamblin] to be sure this branch merges in the right spot for 4.3.0, please.

Please test:
1. New password must not match current password, validation error if not
2. Confirm new password must match new password, validation error if not
3. Submit button disabled until requirements are met.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1714

[~alice] wrote that short passwords (less than 6 characters) cause a validation error. That is still the case.

When I entered "euca" or "test" as the new password and confirm password, I got an inappropriate error that the passwords do not match (see attachment).

At least on Safari, the other validation fixes worked great.

So, will you please make this tweak so we can wrap this one up, [~ashamblin]?
Please retest.

Better. Better.

The page throws a "Passwords must match" error when the two passwords actually match but are fewer than six characters (see attachment). 

Can you please not show this incorrect error in that situation?
Should be good now!  Turns out, I think, that validators when they stack will invalidate downstream validators on failure.  I will do more research after I get back from vacation.

Verified on Chrome Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit), Firefox 41.0.2, and Safari 9.0.1.

UX review passed. Ready for code review.
Punting back to [~ashamblin] to add a missing i18n attribute (see PR comment).
Added missing i18n attribute.
PR 1714 merged

Verified the following conditions:
1. New password must not match current password, validation error if not
2. Confirm new password must match new password, validation error if not
3. Password must be a minimum of six characters
4. Submit button disabled until requirements are met

Verified on: Alice's setup - CLC at 10.111.5.197, console at https://10.111.5.156
Account: eucalyptus/admin
Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
Tested on: IE 11 on Windows 8.1 (Version 11.0.9600.18321)
Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.2.2-0.9454.189.git985325b.el7.src.rpm
Build Date: Wed 15 Jun 2016 05:29:13 PM PDT
